title: Christmas TV Highlights: Festive Shows and Movies to Watch
summary: This article from BBC News previews the Christmas TV schedule, noting that while it may not be as strong as the previous year, there are still many highlights to anticipate. It discusses various festive programs, including the return of Two Doors Down, a Scottish comedy with a Christmas special focusing on neighbors preparing for a new baby and early celebrations. A new film, Finding Father Christmas, features a teenager who believes in Santa and sets out to prove his existence with his cousin. The Princess of Wales hosts her annual carol service at Westminster Abbey, featuring carols and readings from guests. Additionally, Kate Winslet is involved in a new festive film. The article aims to guide viewers through the holiday offerings until the launch of The Traitors in January.
